svg.text:
title: "Week in Ethereum News
July 20, 2024" date: "2024-07-20"
Eth News and Links
EOF remains in Pectra for now, Virgil Griffith sentence reduced, spot ETH ETFs launch
July 23 in US and WazirX (Indian exchange) $230M exploit
All core devs
* All Core Devs - Execution (ACDE) #192 : Pectra (Prague + Electra) upgrade:
Pectra-devnet-1 : local testing found some issues, plan to launch Thursday with all
clients EOF : Remains in Pectra for now, requires extensive testing & fuzzing across
clients Risks of a consensus bug & costs vs benefits debated; Geth strongly against &
won’t champion testing/support, Solidity for Legacy EVM still needs to be supported,
migration is years away, if ever Mainnet still sets defaults for L2s, L2s won’t lead
yet EIP7702 : spec unchanged for now, discussed CODERESET proposal Logs for system
contracts : review async & decide at next ACDC EIP7742 decouple blob count for CL/EL :
discuss at next ACDC RIP7212 secp256r1 precompile on L1 : review async & decide on
inclusion (soon)
* Pectra (Prague + Electra) upgrade: Pectra-devnet-1 : local testing found some issues,
plan to launch Thursday with all clients EOF : Remains in Pectra for now, requires
extensive testing & fuzzing across clients Risks of a consensus bug & costs vs benefits
debated; Geth strongly against & won’t champion testing/support, Solidity for Legacy
EVM still needs to be supported, migration is years away, if ever Mainnet still sets
defaults for L2s, L2s won’t lead yet EIP7702 : spec unchanged for now, discussed
CODERESET proposal Logs for system contracts : review async & decide at next ACDC
EIP7742 decouple blob count for CL/EL : discuss at next ACDC RIP7212 secp256r1
precompile on L1 : review async & decide on inclusion (soon)
* Pectra-devnet-1 : local testing found some issues, plan to launch Thursday with all
clients
* EOF : Remains in Pectra for now, requires extensive testing & fuzzing across clients
Risks of a consensus bug & costs vs benefits debated; Geth strongly against & won’t
champion testing/support, Solidity for Legacy EVM still needs to be supported,
yet
EOF :
* Remains in Pectra for now, requires extensive testing & fuzzing across clients
Remains in Pectra for now, requires extensive testing & fuzzing across clients
* Risks of a consensus bug & costs vs benefits debated; Geth strongly against & won’t
champion testing/support, Solidity for
* Legacy EVM still needs to be supported, migration is years away, if ever
Legacy EVM still needs to be supported, migration is years away, if ever
* Mainnet still sets defaults for L2s, L2s won’t lead yet
Mainnet still sets defaults for L2s, L2s won’t lead yet
* EIP7702 : spec unchanged for now, discussed CODERESET proposal
EIP7702 : spec unchanged for now, discussed CODERESET proposal
* Logs for system contracts : review async & decide at next ACDC
Logs for system contracts : review async & decide at next ACDC
* EIP7742 decouple blob count for CL/EL : discuss at next ACDC
EIP7742 decouple blob count for CL/EL : discuss at next ACDC
* RIP7212 secp256r1 precompile on L1 : review async & decide on inclusion (soon)
RIP7212 secp256r1 precompile on L1 : review async & decide on inclusion (soon)
Osaka + F starname upgrade
* Verkle implementers call #21 : proposal to reduce witness size, updates to EIP6800 &
EIP2935 and cost of code chunking
Centralization watch: threatening the value of your ETH
* 🚨 Lido at 29.15% , still too close to 33.3% threshold
🚨 Lido at 29.15% , still too close to 33.3% threshold
* Client diversity (via clientdiversity.org ): Execution layer: Geth ~55% majority
Consensus layer: Prysm 35% Any client bug over 33.3% could mean loss of finality Potuz:
stress of potential consensus bugs on majority client developers
Client diversity (via clientdiversity.org ):
* Execution layer: Geth ~55% majority
Execution layer: Geth ~55% majority
* Consensus layer: Prysm 35%
Consensus layer: Prysm 35%
* Any client bug over 33.3% could mean loss of finality
Any client bug over 33.3% could mean loss of finality
* Potuz: stress of potential consensus bugs on majority client developers
Potuz: stress of potential consensus bugs on majority client developers
* Better geographic diversity is optimal, particularly outside of North America &
Europe
Better geographic diversity is optimal, particularly outside of North America & Europe
Layer 1
* Blocknative: data viz of self-built blocks , unintentionally increase base fee
volatility
Blocknative: data viz of self-built blocks , unintentionally increase base fee
* EIP7732 ePBS: ePBS breakout #5 : short call, proposer IP leaks requesting headers
from builder and consensus spec tests fixes in progress
EIP7732 ePBS:
* ePBS breakout #5 : short call, proposer IP leaks requesting headers from builder and
consensus spec tests fixes in progress
* Nethermind EVMYulLean : EVM + Yul specification, executable, in Lean
Nethermind EVMYulLean : EVM + Yul specification, executable, in Lean
Research
* Anders Elowsson: sealed execution auction , Vickrey slot auction of execution
proposal rights, attesters supervise commit/reveal scheme facilitated by builders &
beacon proposer
Anders Elowsson: sealed execution auction , Vickrey slot auction of execution proposal
rights, attesters supervise commit/reveal scheme facilitated by builders & beacon
proposer
* Multi-round MEV-Boost : mitigate negatives of based preconfs & retain benefits of
based rollups
Multi-round MEV-Boost : mitigate negatives of based preconfs & retain benefits of based
rollups
Client Releases
* Consensus layer: Lodestar v1.20.2 : patch for publishing blinded blocks using
Lodestar beacon node & Lighthouse/Nimbus validator client with MEV-Boost
Consensus layer:
* Lodestar v1.20.2 : patch for publishing blinded blocks using Lodestar beacon node &
Lighthouse/Nimbus validator client with MEV-Boost
* Execution layer: Reth v1.0.3 : fix for Base mainnet & async Backfill stream
Execution layer:
* Reth v1.0.3 : fix for Base mainnet & async Backfill stream
Layer 2
* Scroll delayed finalization to investigate potential ecosystem incident, confirmed
Rho Markets was application specific
Scroll delayed finalization to investigate potential ecosystem incident, confirmed Rho
Markets was application specific
* L2BEAT Badges : visual display of L2 features
L2BEAT Badges : visual display of L2 features
EIPs/Standards
* EIPs (Ethereum improvement proposals): EIP7745 : Two dimensional log filter data
structure
EIPs (Ethereum improvement proposals):
* EIP7745 : Two dimensional log filter data structure
* ERCs (application layer standards): ERC7743 : Multi-owner non-fungible tokens
(MO-NFT) ERC7744 : Code index (index contract bytecode) ERC7746 : Composable security
middleware hooks
ERCs (application layer standards):
* ERC7743 : Multi-owner non-fungible tokens (MO-NFT)
ERC7743 : Multi-owner non-fungible tokens (MO-NFT)
* ERC7744 : Code index (index contract bytecode)
ERC7744 : Code index (index contract bytecode)
* ERC7746 : Composable security middleware hooks
ERC7746 : Composable security middleware hooks
* EIP.tools adds RIPs (rollup improvement proposals)
EIP.tools adds RIPs (rollup improvement proposals)
Stuff for developers
* Solidity via-IR compilation pipeline explainer: translates Solidity into Yul
(intermediate representation) for optimization rather than direct to bytecode, plan to
make default with EOF
Solidity via-IR compilation pipeline explainer: translates Solidity into Yul
* Solidity hidden overflow : math expression types cast to highest type used by
variables
Solidity hidden overflow : math expression types cast to highest type used by variables
* Solady (Solidity snippets): adds ERC1967 minimal proxies with immutable args , auto
verified on Etherscan
Solady (Solidity snippets): adds ERC1967 minimal proxies with immutable args , auto
* Z0r0z sstore3 , read/write contract storage using balance & address, license: AGPL v3
Z0r0z sstore3 , read/write contract storage using balance & address, license: AGPL v3
* Rindexer , EVM indexing tool in Rust, beta
Rindexer , EVM indexing tool in Rust, beta
* Reth Execution Extension (ExEx) examples
Reth Execution Extension (ExEx) examples
* Echidna v2.2.4 : improves fuzzing speed & user experience, adds support for transient
opcodes
Echidna v2.2.4 : improves fuzzing speed & user experience, adds support for transient
* Audit Wizard adds Cyfrin Aderyn (Solidity static analyzer)
Audit Wizard adds Cyfrin Aderyn (Solidity static analyzer)
* Spice (Python): export data from Dune API
Spice (Python): export data from Dune API
* CTFs: Damn Vulnerable DeFi v4 : migrated to Foundry, new challenges: curvy puppet,
shards, withdrawal & rewarder
CTFs:
* Damn Vulnerable DeFi v4 : migrated to Foundry, new challenges: curvy puppet, shards,
withdrawal & rewarder
Security
* WazirX (Indian exchange) $230M exploit via multisig compromise
WazirX (Indian exchange) $230M exploit via multisig compromise
* LiFi $11.6M exploit on mainnet & Arbitrum via arbitrary call, after contract facet
added, infinite approvals impacted
LiFi $11.6M exploit on mainnet & Arbitrum via arbitrary call, after contract facet
* Minterest $1.4M exploit on Mantle L2 via reentrancy
Minterest $1.4M exploit on Mantle L2 via reentrancy
* Security Alliance (SEAL): incident response to Squarespace domain compromise
Security Alliance (SEAL): incident response to Squarespace domain compromise
Ecosystem
* ETHGlobal Brussels finalists
Enterprise
* Enterprise Ethereum Alliance DeFi risk assessment guidelines
Job Listings
* EF Protocol Support : generalist to help with ACD, EPF, SoP & more
EF Protocol Support : generalist to help with ACD, EPF, SoP & more
* Nethermind: Senior Device Security Engineer , Senior DevOps Engineer AMER & APAC ,
Full Stack Lead APAC, Post-Grad Internship & Chief Marketing Officer
Nethermind: Senior Device Security Engineer , Senior DevOps Engineer AMER & APAC , Full
Stack Lead APAC, Post-Grad Internship & Chief Marketing Officer
* EF seek a European/Civil Law qualified Legal Counsel
EF seek a European/Civil Law qualified Legal Counsel
* Aragon: Senior Smart Contract Developer
Aragon: Senior Smart Contract Developer
Job listings: $600 for 4 issues (75 char limit). Pay using 3cities. Questions?
abcoathup at-gmail
Onchain stats
* Fees (via ultrasound.money ): Gas: 0.9 to 41.7 gwei, 6.8 gwei average; zero net
issuance at 23.6 gwei 13k ETH net issuance this week
Fees (via ultrasound.money ):
* Gas: 0.9 to 41.7 gwei, 6.8 gwei average; zero net issuance at 23.6 gwei
Gas: 0.9 to 41.7 gwei, 6.8 gwei average; zero net issuance at 23.6 gwei
* 13k ETH net issuance this week
13k ETH net issuance this week
* ETHUSD : $3,121 - $3,538, currently $3,488, all time high $4,878
ETHUSD : $3,121 - $3,538, currently $3,488, all time high $4,878
* ETHBTC : currently 0.053 (Flippening at ~0.164)
ETHBTC : currently 0.053 (Flippening at ~0.164)
Regulation/business/tokens
* Virgil Griffith sentence reduced by 7 months, should be going home soon
Virgil Griffith sentence reduced by 7 months, should be going home soon
* Spot ETH ETFs launch July 23 in US ( CETH , FETH , EZET , QETH & ETHV )
Spot ETH ETFs launch July 23 in US ( CETH , FETH , EZET , QETH & ETHV )
General
* Fractal ID (KYC) data breach, includes uploaded images/documents
Fractal ID (KYC) data breach, includes uploaded images/documents
* EF updates mailing list compromise was via Google Workspace bug
EF updates mailing list compromise was via Google Workspace bug
* CrowdStrike update caused Windows hosts to blue screen of death
CrowdStrike update caused Windows hosts to blue screen of death
* Craig Wright is not Satoshi, as per legal notice he is required to share
Craig Wright is not Satoshi, as per legal notice he is required to share
END OF SERVICE: plan to deprecate Week in Ethereum News
Editor: @abcoathup Follow @WeekinEthNews for the most clicked links Permalink:
https://weekinethereumnews.com/week-in-ethereum-news-july-20-2024
Upcoming Dates of Note
(new/changes in bold )
* Jul 29-30 – EDCON Tokyo conference
Jul 29-30 – EDCON Tokyo conference
* Aug 2-4 – Ethereum Argentina conference & hackathon
Aug 2-4 – Ethereum Argentina conference & hackathon
* Aug 7-9 – Science of Blockchain Conference (New York)
Aug 7-9 – Science of Blockchain Conference (New York)
* Aug 15-17 – Ethereum Uruguay hackathon & conference
Aug 15-17 – Ethereum Uruguay hackathon & conference
* Aug 23-Sep 13 – ETHGlobal ETHOnline virtual hackathon
Aug 23-Sep 13 – ETHGlobal ETHOnline virtual hackathon
* Aug 23-26 – ETHTokyo hackathon & conference
Aug 23-26 – ETHTokyo hackathon & conference
* Aug 29-31 – ETHAccra hackathon
Aug 29-31 – ETHAccra hackathon
* Sep 5-8 – ETHWarsaw conference & hackathon
Sep 5-8 – ETHWarsaw conference & hackathon
* Sep 9-15 – ETHSafari (Kenya)
Sep 9-15 – ETHSafari (Kenya)
* Sep 12-14 – NapulETH (Napoli)
Sep 12-14 – NapulETH (Napoli)
* Sep 13-14 – Ethereum México
Sep 13-14 – Ethereum México
* Sep 20-22 – ETHCapeTown hackathon
Sep 20-22 – ETHCapeTown hackathon
* Sep 20-22 – ETHGlobal Singapore hackathon
Sep 20-22 – ETHGlobal Singapore hackathon
* Sep 26-27 – ETHMilan conference
Sep 26-27 – ETHMilan conference
* Oct 4-6 – Ethereum Kuala Lumpur conference & hackathon
Oct 4-6 – Ethereum Kuala Lumpur conference & hackathon
* Oct 4-6 – ETHRome hackathon
Oct 4-6 – ETHRome hackathon
* Oct 17-19 – ETHSofia conference & hackathon
Oct 17-19 – ETHSofia conference & hackathon
* Oct 18-20 – ETHGlobal San Francisco hackathon
Oct 18-20 – ETHGlobal San Francisco hackathon
* Nov 12-15 – Devcon 7 - Southeast Asia (Bangkok)
Nov 12-15 – Devcon 7 - Southeast Asia (Bangkok)
* Nov 15-17 – ETHGlobal Bangkok hackathon
Nov 15-17 – ETHGlobal Bangkok hackathon
